00005 #ifndef __TEMPLATES_HH

00007 
00008 // Protected Linked List
00009 // *** perhaps use a real template definition if that
00010 //     means every type that uses it can reuse the
00011 //     same function code
00012 //
00013 // A linked list with protection against breakage and floating remnants,
00014 // which is also type-safe by using define to create type-specific
00015 // code instead of type-casting from generic code.
00016 // The two classes that are created for each class that uses
00017 // this Protected Linked List template are declared as friends
00018 // of each other, to simplify intuitive processes for such tasks
00019 // as linking and unlinking, without granting any private access to
00020 // either the class using the Protected Linked List template or
00021 // any classes derived from the two additional created classes,
00022 // thereby effectively guarding the link structure against
00023 // changes that could violate the protocol.
00024 /* Schematic of the structure:
00025 
00026    +----+     +----+     +----+     +----+
00027    |obj1|     |obj2|     |obj3|     |obj4|
00028    |inh.|     |inh.|     |inh.|     |inh.|
00029    |PLL |     |PLL |     |PLL |     |PLL |
00030    +----+ next+----+     +----+     +----+
00031 +->|PLL1|<--->|PLL2|<--->|PLL3|<--->|PLL4|<-+
00032 |  +----+prev +----+     +----+     +----+  |
00033 |     \          \         /          /     |   PLL and
00034 |      \__________\_______/__________/      |   PLLRoot
00035 |           root      |                     |   are
00036 |                     v                     |   friends
00037 |         head  +-----------+  tail         |
00038 +---------------|  PLLRoot  |---------------+
00039                 +-----------+
00040                      ### (local, global or new-allocated)
00041         +----------------------------+
00042         | class, function or program |
00043         +----------------------------+
00044 
00045 */
00046 // a - Protected Linked List class and its Root class, add these
00047 //     above the class header
00048 #define Protected_Linked_List(PLLType) \
00049 class PLLType; \
00050 class PLLRoot_##PLLType; \
00051 class PLL_##PLLType { \
00052         friend PLLRoot_##PLLType; \
00053         protected: \
00054                 PLLRoot_##PLLType * pllroot; \
00055                 PLLType * pllnext, * pllprev; \
00056         public: \
00057                 PLLType(): pllroot(NULL), pllnext(NULL), pllprev(NULL) {} \
00058                 PLLRoot_##PLLType * Root() { return pllroot; } \
00059                 PLLType * Next() { return next; } \
00060                 PLLType * Prev() { return prev; } \
00061                 inline PLLType * el(int n); \
00062                 inline PLLType * head(); \
00063                 inline PLLType * tail(); \
00064                 inline int length(); \
00065                 inline int fulllength(); \
00066                 inline bool insert_this_after(PLLType * pred); \
00067                 inline bool insert_this_before(PLLType * succ); \
00068                 inline bool insert_after_this(PLLType * nsrt); \
00069                 inline bool insert_before_this(PLLType * nsrt); \
00070                 inline bool unlink_before(PLLType * succ); \
00071                 inline bool unlink_after(PLLType * pred); \
00072 }; \
00073 class PLLRoot_##PLLType { \
00074         friend PLL_##PLLType; \
00075         protected: \
00076                 PLLType * pllhead; \
00077                 PLLType * plltail; \
00078         public: \
00079                 ~PLLRoot_##PLLType() { delete pllhead; } \
00080                 PLLRoot_##PLLType(): pllhead(NULL), plltail(NULL) {} \
00081                 PLLType * head() { return pllhead; } \
00082                 PLLType * tail() { return plltail; } \
00083                 PLLType * el(int n) { if (pllhead) return pllhead->el(n); return NULL; } \
00084                 PLLType * operator[](int n) { return el(n); } \
00085                 int length() { if (pllhead) return pllhead->length(); return 0; } \
00086                 inline bool link_before(PLLRoot_##PLLType * succ); \
00087                 inline bool link_before(PLLType * succ); \
00088                 inline bool link_after(PLLRoot_##PLLType * pred); \
00089                 inline bool link_after(PLLType * pred); \
00090 }
00091 // b - Protected Linked List inheritance, add this into the list
00092 //     of inherited classes
00093 #define Protected_Linked_List_Class(PLLType) \
00094         public PLL_PLLType
00095 // c - Protected Linked List inline functions, add this after
00096 //     the class
00097 //              insert_this_*() returns true if linked, false if first topic in new list
00098 //              el() returns the nth offset element in the linked list (either direction)
00099 #define Protected_Linked_List_functions(PLLType) \
00100         inline bool PLLType::insert_this_after(PLLType * pred) { \
00101                 if (!pred) { \
00102                         next = NULL; \
00103                         prev = NULL; \
00104                         return false; \
00105                 } \
00106                 prev = pred; \
00107                 next = pred->Next(); \
00108                 pred->insert_after_this(this); \
00109                 if (next) next->insert_before_this(this); \
00110                 return true; \
00111         } \
00112         inline bool PLLType::insert_this_before(PLLType * succ) { \
00113                 if (!succ) { \
00114                         next = NULL; \
00115                         prev = NULL; \
00116                         return false; \
00117                 } \
00118                 next = succ; \
00119                 prev = succ->Prev(); \
00120                 succ->insert_before_this(this); \
00121                 if (prev) prev->insert_after_this(this); \
00122                 return true; \
00123         } \
00124         inline bool PLLType::insert_after_this(PLLType * nsrt) { \
00125                 if (!nsrt) return false; \
00126                 if (nsrt->Prev()!=this) nsrt->insert_this_after(this); \
00127                 else next = nsrt; \
00128                 return true; \
00129         } \
00130         inline bool PLLType::insert_before_this(PLLType * nsrt) { \
00131                 if (!nsrt) return false; \
00132                 if (nsrt->Next()!=this) nsrt->insert_this_before(this); \
00133                 else prev = nsrt; \
00134                 return true; \
00135         } \
00136         inline PLLType * PLLType::el(int n) { \
00137                 if (!n) return this; \
00138                 if (n>0) { \
00139                         if (next) return next->el(n-1); \
00140                         else return NULL; \
00141                 } else { \
00142                         if (prev) return prev->el(n+1); \
00143                         else return NULL; \
00144                 } \
00145         } \
00146         inline PLLType * PLLType::head() { \
00147                 if (!prev) return this; \
00148                 return prev->head(); \
00149         } \
00150         inline PLLType * PLLType::tail() { \
00151                 if (!next) return this; \
00152                 return next->tail(); \
00153         } \
00154         inline int PLLType::length() { \
00155                 if (Next()) return 1 + Next()->length(); \
00156                 return 1; \
00157         } \
00158         inline int PLLType::fulllength() { \
00159                 return head()->length(); \
00160         } \
00161         inline void set_root(PLLType * h) { ***private function
00162                 for (; (h); h = h->Next()) h->pllroot = this;
00163         }
00164         inline void update() {
00165         // clears head and tail if elements were linked to another root
00166         // or fixes head and tail if either one pointed to an element with
00167         // a different root
00168                 if (pllhead) if (pllhead->Root()!=this) pllhead = NULL;
00169                 if (plltail) {
00170                         if (plltail->Root()!=this) {
00171                                 if (!pllhead) plltail = NULL;
00172                                 else plltail = pllhead->seek_tail();
00173                         } else {
00174                                 if (!pllhead) pllhead = plltail->seek_head();
00175                         }
00176                 }
00177         }
00178         inline bool PLLRoot_##PLLType::link_before(PLLRoot_##PLLType * succ) {
00179                 if (!succ) return false;
00180                 if (!succ->head()) return false;
00181                 // *** could call update() here first to insure that pllhead and plltail
00182                 //     are correct
00183                 if (plltail) {
00184                         plltail->pllnext = succ->head();
00185                         succ->head()->pllprev = plltail;
00186                 } else pllhead = succ->head();
00187                 plltail = succ->tail();
00188                 set_root(succ->head());
00189                 succ->update();
00190                 return true;
00191         } \
00192         inline bool PLLRoot_##PLLType::link_before(PLLType * succ) { \
00193                 if (!succ) ... \
00194                 if (!succ->Root()) link anyway... \
00195         } \
00196         inline bool PLLRoot_##PLLType::link_after(PLLRoot_##PLLType * pred) { \
00197                 if (!pred) return false;
00198                 if (!pred->tail()) return false;
00199                 // *** could call update() here first to insure that pllhead and plltail
00200                 //     are correct
00201                 if (pllhead) {
00202                         pllhead->pllprev = pred->tail();
00203                         pred->tail()->pllnext = pllhead;
00204                 } else plltail = pred->head();
00205                 pllhead = pred->head();
00206                 set_root(pred->head());
00207                 pred->update();
00208                 return true;
00209         }\
00210         inline bool PLLRoot_##PLLType::link_after(PLLType * pred) { \
00211         }
00212 // d - Protected Linked List macro that can be used to
00213 //     access functions in linked elements at a relative
00214 //     distance n from an element
00215 #define Protected_Linked_List_Indexed_Access(PLLType,Here,There) \
00216         if (!n) return Here; \
00217         if (PLLType * e = el(n)) return e->There; else return NULL
00218 
00219 #endif
00220 // e - Protected Linked List macro that loops forward through
00221 //     linked elements contingent upon a test, providing the
00222 //     pointer e to the current element
00223 #define PLL_LOOP_FORWARD(PLLType,Init_El,Extra_Test) \
00224         for (PLLType * e = Init_El; ((e) && (Extra_Test)); e = e->Next())
